basics.name: Loelle Lam
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024. After graduation, I plan to pursue a Master's in Computer Science at UHM.

highlights: Process JSON data and feed it into the COSMOS propagator. Write the output back into a JSON file.
Write clear and concise documentation for all COSMOS projects
Troubleshoot software, hardware and networking issues over the phone
Respond to phone calls, emails, chat inquires directed to the ITS Help Desk
Create and present a workshop offering tips for success in computer science

volunteer.organization: Association for Computing Machinery at Mānoa
highlights: Grey Hats (Jan 2022 - May 2022): Attend biweekly meetings and learn about cybersecurity.
Programming and Algorithms (Aug 2021 - Dec 2021): Attend weekly meetings to discuss and tackle interview-style programming problems.

volunteer.summary: Treasurer for the 808 Cleanups Club at Roosevelt High School
highlights: Remove litter, graffiti, and marine debris from all around the island of Oahu
Document and strategize the allocation of club funds

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded to students that earn a semester GPA of 3.5 or higher as a full-time student.

awards.title: Lung Doo Benevolent Society Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded to students of Lung Doo descent based on academic merit.

awards.title: Manoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded to students with a minimum 3.8 GPA upon the time of application to the University of Hawaii at Manoa.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.
